### Contributing

* For one-time contributions you can simply open a Pull Request on GitHub. Before you do so, you
  should read our [PR Guidelines](https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3/wiki/PR-Guidelines).

* If you want to add a new `Learner`, `PipeOp` or `Measure` you can check out the chapter
[extending](https://mlr3book.mlr-org.com/extending.html) of the mlr3 book.

* If you want to add a new R package to the mlr3 ecosystem or collaborate on an existing one,
  you can contact us on [mattermost](https://lmmisld-lmu-stats-slds.srv.mwn.de/mlr_invite/).

* You can also contribute by [sponsoring us](https://github.com/sponsors/mlr-org).

### Information for Developers

Information for developers is summarized in our [Wiki](https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3/wiki).
